bestBHT.bht: The disciples' failure to grasp the depth of Jesus' warning about the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod left Him deeply hurt and astonished. Their mistaken focus on material concerns, like bread, instead of spiritual comprehension revealed their low thoughts of Him. Despite previously entrusting their temporal needs to the Twelve, they remained blind to the profound truths He was imparting. These glimpses into their flawed reasoning and Jesus' disappointment serve as a poignant reminder for those who earnestly seek greater understanding of the spiritual dimensions of His teachings.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The nine questions following each other in rapid succession (...) show how deeply He was hurt at this want of spiritual apprehension, and worse still, their low thoughts of Him, as if He would utter so solemn a warning on so petty a subject.

It will be seen, however, from the very form of their conjecture, 'It is because we have no bread,' and our Lord's astonishment that they should not by that time have known better with what He took up His attention—that He ever left the whole care for His own temporal wants to the Twelve.
Who that, like angels, 'desire to look into these things' will not prize such glimpses above gold?
Philip Schaff: Mark 8:16. The sense of this verse is clear, but the form varies in the early authorities.
Archibald T. Robertson: They reasoned one with another (διελογιζοντο προς αλληλους), implying discussion. Imperfect tense, kept it up. Matthew 16:7 has εν εαυτοις, in themselves or among themselves.
John Gill: It is because we have no bread; that he says these words; tacitly chiding and reproving us...

bhtAttempts.bht: The disciples, in their lack of understanding, questioned among themselves why Jesus was cautioning them about the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod. Jesus was astonished by their spiritual ignorance and their focus on material concerns like bread, when He had always entrusted their temporal needs to God. These glimpses into the disciples' flawed reasoning and Jesus' disappointment serve as a valuable lesson to those who seek to understand the deeper spiritual truths.

The disciples' lack of spiritual perception and low thoughts of Jesus surprised and hurt Him deeply. They failed to grasp the true meaning behind His warning about the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod, instead focusing on their own temporal concerns like bread. Jesus had always entrusted the Twelve with the care of His own temporal needs, so it was disheartening to see their lack of understanding. These glimpses into the disciples' flawed reasoning and Jesus' disappointment serve as a valuable lesson for those who desire to comprehend the profound spiritual truths embedded in His teachings.

The disciples' failure to grasp the depth of Jesus' warning about the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod left Him deeply hurt and astonished. Their mistaken focus on material concerns, like bread, instead of spiritual comprehension revealed their low thoughts of Him. Despite previously entrusting their temporal needs to the Twelve, they remained blind to the profound truths He was imparting. These glimpses into their flawed reasoning and Jesus' disappointment serve as a poignant reminder for those who earnestly seek greater understanding of the spiritual dimensions of His teachings.

The disciples' shallow understanding and trivial focus on bread instead of comprehending Jesus' warning about the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod deeply hurt Him. Despite consistently entrusting His temporal needs to the Twelve, they failed to perceive the profound spiritual truths being imparted. These glimpses into their flawed reasoning and Jesus' disappointment serve as a valuable lesson for those who truly desire a deeper comprehension of His teachings.

The disciples' lack of spiritual apprehension and their misguided focus on bread instead of understanding Jesus' warning about the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod deeply hurt Him. He was astonished that they had not yet realized His attention was not on His own temporal wants. These glimpses into their flawed reasoning and Jesus' disappointment are of great value to those who seek to understand these profound truths.
